content: "Aleko" - Libretto Overview (Condensed to 650 Characters)Act 1: Aleko, a young man of noble birth, has abandoned his former life to live with a group of gypsies. He is in love with Tatyana, but she is already in a relationship with Demon, a fellow gypsy. Aleko is consumed with jealousy and confronts Tatyana, accusing her of betrayal.Act 2: Tatyana is torn between her love for Demon and her sympathy for Aleko. As tensions rise, Aleko becomes increasingly paranoid, unable to accept that Tatyana has chosen Demon.Act 3: Overcome by jealousy and rage, Aleko kills Demon, but in the end, he is rejected by Tatyana.
